Fleet Assistant Job at DreamWorks Global Logistics Limited




        
    

        
        DreamWorks Global Logistics Limited - We link manufacturers with numerous customers in over 100 cities and villages across Nigeria, getting their products to them seamlessly and rapidly. We have a precise customer-focused strategy that addresses our customers’ supply chain requirements seamlessly. We know how to deliver!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fleet Assistant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking an organized and detail-oriented Fleet/Logistics Assistant to assist the management of our fleet and coordinate logistics operations.
	The successful candidate will ensure the efficient and timely movement of goods, manage vehicle maintenance schedules, optimize routes, and ensure compliance with all relevant regulations.
	This position requires strong organizational skills, a proactive attitude, and the ability to work under pressure.


Responsibilities


	Assist with the day-to-day operations of the company’s fleet, including vehicle scheduling, maintenance, and compliance with safety regulations.
	Coordinate logistics for the transportation of goods, ensuring on-time delivery and cost efficiency.
	Assist in fleet performance, including vehicle condition, fuel consumption, and route optimization, and recommend improvements.
	Manage the scheduling of drivers, ensuring proper allocation of resources based on demand and efficiency.
	Maintain accurate records of fleet activities, including vehicle inspections, repairs, insurance, and other necessary documentation.
	Collaborate with drivers and other teams to resolve logistical challenges and delays.
	Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal regulations, including transportation safety and licensing requirements.
	Negotiate and maintain relationships with third-party logistics providers, vendors, and contractors.
	Coordinate with the procurement team to manage the acquisition of new vehicles or equipment as necessary.
	Perform periodic inspections of vehicles and equipment to ensure they meet operational standards and safety requirements.


Requirements


	National Diploma (ND) in Mechanical Engineering, Logistics, Supply Chain Management with 0-2 years experience.
	Experience in fleet management, logistics coordination, or a similar role.
	Strong understanding of fleet management systems, logistics software, and tools.
	Familiarity with transportation and safety regulations.
	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Ability to work effectively under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to resolving logistical challenges.
	Experience in negotiating with suppliers, service providers, and other external partners.
	Candidate must reside in or be in close proximity to Ajao Estate and its environs.


Salary
N70,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: dglhrexecutive@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location (Lagos) as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Openings at DMOT Enterprises
content:
DMOT Enterprises provides Business Center, General Trading, Contract Management with companies, Consultancy, Resource hiring, training and counseling services.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Project Accountant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Qualifications & Requirements
     

            
    




	HND/Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or related field.
	2–5years of experience in similar role
	Professional qualification of ACA will be an advantage.
	Must have relevant experience as a Project Accountant.
	Ready to work and attend interviews on the Mainland.


Application Closing Date: 30th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ayomaku@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Modern Trade Sales Supervisor

Job Location: Ogere Remo, Ogun

	Ready to work and attend interviews at location.


Application Closing Date: 21st January, 2026.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ayomaku@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Method of Application

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Job Openings at Costarchem Nigeria
content:
Costarchem Nigeria is a subsidiary of costar USA. The company is a world leader in the delivery of tailored Constructive Solutions for virtually any type of construction project, combining high-quality products, expert technical support, customer service and innovation.

Costar Building Product system has been producing innovative construction chemicals that help gives strength and increase the life span of a modern building.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales Executive

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Actively seek new sales opportunities on the field through cold calling and networking
	Set up meetings with potential clients and listen to their wishes and concerns
	Prepare and deliver appropriate presentations on products and services
	Conduct market research to identify selling possibilities and evaluate customer needs
	Create frequent reviews and reports with sales and financial data
	Ensure the availability of stock for sales and demonstrations
	Researchand pursuenew business opportunities in the target environment
	Secure and renew orders, complete sales process, and arrange deliveries.
	Participate on behalf of the company in exhibitions or conferences
	Negotiate/close deals and handle complaints or objections
	Collaborate with team members to achieve better results
	Achieve given sales goals and targets
	Gather feedback from customers or prospects and share with internal teams
	Handle customer questions, inquiries, and complaints


Required Competencies


	Bachelor’s Degree in sciences, administration or related field.
	Experience in sales and the technology field.
	Strong communication, interpersonal, customer service, and sales skills
	The ability to relate technical information to non-technical customers.
	Excellent technical and problem-solving skills
	Fast learner and passion for sales.
	Good leadership and team working skills.
	Self-motivated with a results-driven approach.
	Aptitude in delivering attractive presentations with good communication skills.


Application Closing Date: 31st January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@costarchem.com using the Job Position as subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Production Manager

Job Location: Sagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary 


	The Production Manager is responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of chemical production activities, ensuring efficiency, quality, safety, and compliance with industry regulations.
	This role requires strong leadership and a deep understanding of chemical manufacturing processes to drive productivity while maintaining the highest standards of health, safety, and environmental practices.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, coordinate, and control all manufacturing operations to meet production targets in line with company objectives.
	Oversee the formulation, blending, batching, and packaging processes to ensure accuracy, consistency, and quality.
	Ensure strict adherence to safety, health, and environmental regulations (e.g., NAFDAC, SON, ISO standards).
	Supervise, train, and develop the production team, including supervisors, technicians, and operators.
	Monitor production performance, analyze KPIs, and implement corrective actions where necessary.
	Coordinate with Quality Control, Maintenance, Supply Chain, and other departments for seamless operations.
	Develop and manage production budgets, minimize waste, and optimize resource utilization.
	Ensure proper maintenance of plant machinery and equipment in coordination with the engineering team.
	Lead continuous improvement initiatives (e.g., lean manufacturing, 5S, Kaizen) to improve efficiency and product quality.
	Prepare regular production reports and present updates to senior management.


Qualifications and Experience


	B.Sc./HND in Chemical Engineering, Industrial Chemistry, or related discipline.
	Minimum of 9–12years of experience in chemical or related manufacturing industries, with at least 6years in a managerial role.
	Proven experience in managing production teams and processes in a regulated environment.


Skills and Competencies:


	Strong leadership and team management skills.
	In-depth knowledge of chemical production processes and quality systems.
	Sound understanding of HSE standards and compliance requirements.
	Proficiency in production planning tools and ERP systems.
	Excellent analytical, organizational, and decision-making skills.
	Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities and work under pressure.


Application Closing Date: 31st January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@costarchem.com using the Job Position as subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Production Supervisor

Job Location: Sagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties


	Supervising the manufacturing processes, ensuring quality work is done safely and efficiently.
	Liaising with other engineers to develop plans that improve production, costs, and labor required.
	Diagnosing problems in the production line and providing recommendations and training.
	Establishing safety procedures and protocols that take the workers' well-being into account, and that also minimize the carbon footprint.
	Keeping abreast of advancements in engineering and production, and sharing knowledge with co-workers.
	Identifying, documenting, and reporting unsafe practices.
	Drawing up production schedules and budgets for projects.
	Scheduling meetings with relevant departments and stakeholders.
	Analyzing all facets of production and making recommendations for improvement.
	Obtaining any materials and equipment required.
	Responsibility for establishing and maintaining control of process metrics and data such as cycle time, productivity, downtime, and product properties, to ensure existing processes are in control
	Lead product deviation processes, securing root-cause analysis and implementation of corrective/preventive actions
	Production suitability analysis, gap/risk identification, and improvement recommendations
	Infrastructure selection, inventory management and plant capacity/utilization reporting
	Production automation
	Production process enhancement.


Requirements


	Degree in Engineering, preferably Mechanical Engineering
	3 – 5 years of relevant work experience in a manufacturing plant
	Proficiency in MS Office.
	Proven experience in the engineering field.
	Superb analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
	Strong leadership abilities.
	Superb written and verbal communication skills.
	Ability to make decisions under pressure.


Application Closing Date: 30th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: hr@costarchem.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Vacancies at Biorapid Diagnostics Nigeria Limited
content:
Biorapid Diagnostics Nigeria Limited is a one-stop shop as a trusted medical equipment supplier, offering comprehensive services including sample testing, evaluation, and diagnosis. Moreover, through the integration of cutting-edge technology, we consistently deliver highly effective diagnostic services in over500 laboratories, both within Nigeria and internationally.In addition, we are deeply committed to advancing a customized and step wise diagnostics model in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Medical Laboratory Scientist (Marketing Lead / Head of Marketing Team)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Role: Head of Marketing Team
     

            
    



Job Description


	Lead and manage the marketing team to drive sales growth
	Promote medical laboratory equipment, reagents, and consumables
	Develop and execute effective marketing and business development strategies
	Engage healthcare facilities, laboratories, hospitals, and key stakeholders
	Provide market intelligence and expand the company’s presence within the medical terrain


Requirements & Qualifications


	B.Sc. in Medical Laboratory Science (MLS)
	Valid MLS License
	Proven work experience in medical laboratory equipment, reagents, and consumables
	Strong understanding of the medical and diagnostic terrain
	Demonstrated leadership ability and experience managing a team
	Proven track record of performance and results
	Must have a strong flair for marketing, sales, and relationship management
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills.


Compensation


	This role comes with an attractive and competitive remuneration package.


Application Closing Date: 30th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: career@biorapidiag.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

 

2.) Accountant (Debt Recovery & Reconciliation Officer)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) & Environs
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Debt recovery and follow-up with clients
	Account reconciliation and financial record management
	Monitoring outstanding payments and preparing recovery reports
	Working closely with management to ensure timely revenue recovery


Requirements


	B.Sc. in Accounting
	Minimum of 3 years of working experience in a private sector or professional firm
	Proven experience in debt recovery and account reconciliation
	Strong analytical and reporting skills
	High level of integrity and attention to detail
	Must be resident within or around Asokoro, Nyanya, Karu, Mararaba, Jikwoyi, Kurudu, or Karshi.


Application Closing Date: 28th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter  to: career@biorapidiag.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

 

3.) Digital Media Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Summary


	We are seeking a creative, skilled, and team-oriented Digital Media Officer to join our growing organization.


Key Responsibilities & Required Skills
The ideal candidate should have working knowledge of the following:


	Social Media Management
	Digital Marketing
	Graphic Design
	Video Editing
	Web Design (HTML & CMS platforms)
	Content Creation & Curation


Key Attributes:


	Proficient in the above digital media skills
	Creative, innovative, and detail-oriented
	Willing to work collaboratively within a team
	Result-driven with good communication skills


Location Requirement:


	Applicants must reside in Abuja, preferably within or around: Nyanya, Karu, Jikwoyi, Kurudu, Karshi, Mararaba, or Asokoro axis.


Application Closing Date: 25th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover Letter and Curriculum Vitae (CV) to: career@biorapidiag.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: For enquiries, call the HR on: 07045599989.
